N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2605.6 - Issuance of confirmation letters

State Regulations
(a) After the final determination as to which
project sponsors will be offered assistance from the fund has been made
pursuant to these regulations, the corporation will provide each selected
project sponsor with a written confirmation as to the amount of financial
assistance that has been reserved for the eligible project. (b) Such confirmation letter may include the
conditions that a project sponsor must meet before the corporation shall
provide any assistance from the fund. If an applicant fails to take timely
action to complete the application process, and commence receiving assistance
from the fund within three years of the date of such confirmation letter, the
confirmation letter will be withdrawn and no financial assistance will be made
to the project sponsor pursuant thereto. (c) If a project sponsor notifies the
corporation that an eligible project for which a confirmation letter has been
issued will not be constructed, or if a confirmation letter is withdrawn for
any reason, the confirmation letter shall be deemed null and void and the
unused loan capacity redirected for a future funding
period. Notes
